result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Trial Judge - Br 7

03:20 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.  Competency hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
PSA Report
